text:
Introduction

The nature makes group since the Big Bang time (History Tracers, 2024), we, as natural living beings, also follow it. The humans grouping do not need to make something, some groups, we make them looking for something common, an equality (History Tracers, 2024), an example of these groups were made by Christian Jurgensen Thomsem when he categorized a division for time known as "Three-Age System", that groups human prehistory in Stone Age, Bronze Age (2300-700 BCE), and Iron Age (700-1 BCE) (Heizer, R. F., 1962, pp. 259 ; Barzun, J. et al., 2023, The Metal Ages). The Doctor Christian Jurgensen Thomsem's conclusions are good for a European context, but can we apply it to Abya Yala/America?

When we study the historical moments, we have for Europe the named Middle Ages (500 to 1400-1500 D.C.), that has this name due Christian worldview (Barzun, J. et al., 2023, The Metal Ages). Part of this period was named in the past as Dark Ages, but nowadays is named Migration Period (Britannica, T. Editors of Encyclopaedia, 2018). Can use this period, that have a worldview not present in Abya Yala/América before the European people arrive, to understand the Indigenous?

The issues with Three-Age System

In the context of this research, it is necessary to highlight the following subjects in Robert F. Heizer's work:
  • Separate the human prehistory in Stone Age, Bronze Age (2300 - 700 A.C), and Iron Age (700 - 1 A.C) (Heizer, R. F., 1962, pp. 259).
  • There are sentences about a supposed European superiority when compared with Indigenous (Heizer, R. F., 1962, pp. 260 - 261), this is a thinking without basis (History Tracers, 2024).
  • He shows how the idea of an earth with 6000 years were shown wrong (Heizer, R. F., 1962, pp. 261 - 262).

To consider the indigenous living in Abya Yala/América are "selvage" living beings, is a clear proof of misunderstanding of indigenous history. The people of Caral city - Peru (Ruta Caral, 2024 ; Youtube - Caral Perú Oficial, 2024) probably made a writing system (Mann, Charles C., 2005, pp. 1008 ; History Tracers, 2024) and had complex buildings and organization that ranks the city as one of the first cities (ceremonial center) made in the world (Mann, Charles C., 2005, pp. 1008).

Figure 1: Photo of piramid H1 in the arqueological site of Caral (Ruta Caral, 2024 ; Youtube - Caral Perú Oficial, 2024). Photo taken on June 13, 2017 during a visit to the site.

Few millennia later, in the North of the continent, the city of Teotihuacan reached a level to have 100,000 people, becoming the sixth city of the world in population size (INAH, 2024).

Figure 2: General photo of Teotihuacan city. Photo taken on October 20, 2016 during a visit to the site.

Another issue, that has relationship with unknown Indigenous history, is a definition of period of time considering only Bronze and Iron. The metallurgy was also present in Abya Yala/América, we know Indigenous worked with Copper (CU), Silver (Ag) and Gold (Au) in the South of the continent for at least three millennia (Guédron, S., et al., 2021). It is also accepted, that using a maritime route, this technology reached the North of Abya Yala/Américan continent (Hosler, D., 1988).

The issues with historical time

The "Middle Age" is a period of time that defines events in Europe (Barzun, J. et al., 2023, The Middle Ages). Is it correct to use it in Abya Yala/America? Should we have the own periods for the continents and their inhabitants? The fact that in Europe, after the Middle Ages, there is a period named Renaissance, with return of cultural elements from Greece and Roma and a "march of modernity and progress" (Barzun, J. et al., 2023, The Renaissance), shows that Europeanfacts were completely different of events happening in different places Abya Yala/América, like Mesoamerica (Universidad Nacional Autónoma de México) and Andes (National Museum of the American Indian), so there is a necessity to have periods to understand the Indigenous.

Reflection 1: About the word history
The human time is split in two periods, the history and prehistory, considering the invention of writing system. Considering that we do not have a unique group of period of time that describes the human history, should we also split history and prehistory time per population?

Indigenous period

The Abya Yala/Américan continent dimensions create the necessity to have archeological periods per region, as John Howland Rowe demonstrates (Rowe, J. H., 1945, pp. 265 - 266). Years later, John H. Rowe published another research showing the relationship between periods and stages, going deeper in the discussion (Rowe, J. H., 1962).

The first period, Lithic, has an uncertainty. Despite to be more or less accept that people reached the continent around 13500 years ago, there are researches showing the possibility people arrived around 30000 years ago (Roca-Rada, Xavier, et al., 2020, pp. 2 ; Becerra-Valdivia, L., Higham, T., 2020 ; Pirula, 2017). These divergences are results of knowledge evolution (Ferro Virginia, Maria. Virgina 2013) allowed by Scientific Method (History Tracers (2024): Scientific Method). According to this scenario, we are going to use the most common period of time used in different papers:

Time interval (Years)Europe (Tools / History) [1]Andes (By Luiz G. Lumbreras) [2]Mesoamerica [3]Brazil [4]
~ 35000 - 28000 BCEPaleolithic / Prehistory Without settlement Without settlement Without settlement
~ 28000 - 10000 BCE Lithic Lithic Paleoindian
10000 - 7000 BCE Archaic
7000 - 5000 BCENeolithic / Prehistory
5000 - 4000 BCEArchaic
4000 - 3200 BCENeolithic / Ancient AgeArchaic
3200 - 2500 BCEMetal Ages / Ancient Ages
2500 - 2300 BCEPreclassic
2300 - 2000 BCE
2000 - 1000 BCE Formative
1000 - 1 BCE Archaic / Formative
1 BCE - 150 CE/ Ancient Age
150 - 200 CE Classic
200 - 476 CERegional Development
476 - 500 CE / Middle Ages
500 - 900 CEWari Empire
900 - 1100 CEPostclassicFormative
1100 - 1400 CERegional States
1400 - 1453 CEInca Empire
1453 - 1500 CE/ Modern Ages
1500 - 1519 CEColonial
1519 - 1532 CEColonial
1532 - 1789 CEColonial

1 Encyclopedia Britannica (Barzun, J. et al., 2023), Victor Duruy (Duruy, Victor, 1894), and Horace Craig Longwell (Longwell, Horace C., 1928, pp. 9).
2 Luiz G. Lumbreras (Ferro Virginia, Maria. Virgina 2013 ; Lumbreras, Luis G., 36 - 59).
[3] Xavier Roca-Rada et al. (Roca-Rada, Xavier, et al., 2020 )
[4] Camilo De Mello Vasconcellos et al. (Vasconcellos, Camilo De Mello, et al., 2000, pp. 235).

In different regions are used the same name for different Ages, so, it always suggested citing names together the region avoiding confusion.

Conclusion

Human Ages are made according to understanding about a region. When we try to carry these definitions to other places on earth, we have the risk to express incorrectly local people events. The Age definition can be changed according to new researches, because of the knowledge progress.
